column4: anyone else know about triple-booting? or at least installing ubuntu?
haven't really been watching your discussion. Can you sum it up? perhaps i can be of help
don't thank me yet, haven't done anything ;-)

i have a fresh laptop with vista installed. i used the livecd to make partitions to install xp and ubuntu. i'm pretty sure i did the partitions right. i've installed xp, but can't load into vista obviously because of the bootloader. don't have a vista cd. trying to install ubuntu currently but when its at the installation, it sees no partitions just "unallocated" with my total...
and have you checked the output of fdisk?
it sees all the partitions i made earlier
did you reboot of the live cd? the kernel tends to not use the right partition scheme if you haven't rebooted sometimes
reboot of the livecd?
yes.
what exactly does this mean
after you've changed the partitions, have you rebooted your system?
definitely. i've installed xp and stuff.
alright. So if i see this right, the installer doesn't see any partitions while fdisk does?
yes, and the livecd sees the drives ie., C:\, F:\
but aren't you attempting to install of the live cd? Another thought is to create the partitions yourself first and then start the installer.
thats exactly what i've done. i just made partitions a few hours ago. i'm using the livecd right now.
and did you create a file system on those partitions?
of course.
if you'd like to see the result of the fdisk, i can paste it
hmm ... it's odd that the installer isn't working. The output would be useful yes.
in here or PM?
are you still there?
getting my messages?
